intro: Phacelia foliosa, commonly known as the leafy phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and streambanks. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to attract pollinators. Phacelia foliosa is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
